subject: english
source: Uganda National Curriculum Development Centre (NCDC) - P2 Thematic Curriculum

themes.name: Our School and Neighbourhood
competences: Read simple sentences with expression and understanding
Identify main ideas in short texts
Write simple sentences about school
Use capital letters and full stops correctly
Spell CVC and simple words correctly
Listen to and follow multi-step instructions
Speak about school experiences in simple sentences
Use basic sentence structure (subject, verb, object)
Recognize and use common nouns (school, teacher, friend)
Understand and use prepositions (in, on, under, near)

themes.name: Our Home and Community
competences: Read and understand family-related vocabulary
Write simple sentences about family members
Use possessive pronouns (my, your, his, her)
Describe family relationships using appropriate words
Listen to stories about families
Speak about family in complete sentences
Recognize and use verbs related to family activities
Form plurals correctly
Use adjectives to describe family members
Read and write community-related words

themes.name: The Human Body and Health
competences: Name body parts and spell them correctly
Read health-related vocabulary
Write sentences about health and hygiene
Use imperative verbs for health instructions (wash, eat, sleep)
Listen to health information attentively
Give simple health advice using appropriate language
Read and understand health instructions
Use 'must' and 'should' for health guidance
Describe health conditions using appropriate vocabulary
Create posters with health messages

themes.name: Food and Nutrition
competences: Read and spell food names
Write sentences about favorite foods
Use countable and uncountable nouns for food (apples/rice)
Read and understand nutrition vocabulary
Listen to recipes and food-related stories
Speak about food preferences and nutrition
Use adjectives to describe food (sweet, salty, healthy)
Write simple recipes with instructions
Understand and use 'some' and 'any' with food items
Read labels and understand food information

themes.name: Transport in Our Community
competences: Read and spell names of vehicles
Write sentences about different means of transport
Use 'can' and 'cannot' to describe vehicle capabilities
Listen to stories about journeys and travel
Speak about preferred modes of transport
Read safety instructions for different vehicles
Write simple directions using vocabulary (left, right, forward)
Use past tense to describe journey experiences
Understand traffic signs and their meanings
Create stories about travel adventures

themes.name: Things We Make
competences: Read and spell words related to crafts and making
Write instructions for making objects
Use sequential words (first, then, next, finally)
Listen to descriptions of objects
Describe things made using appropriate adjectives
Read and understand technical vocabulary for crafts
Write sentences about materials and processes
Use verbs related to making (cut, paste, draw, build)
Create simple diagrams with labels
Write stories about creative processes

themes.name: Accidents and Safety
competences: Read and understand safety vocabulary
Write safety rules and warnings
Use imperative forms for safety instructions (Stop, Look, Listen)
Listen to and remember safety messages
Speak about accident prevention
Read and understand warning signs
Write stories about staying safe
Use 'must', 'must not', 'should' for safety advice
Understand and follow emergency instructions
Create safety posters with clear messages

themes.name: Work and Livelihoods
competences: Read and spell occupational names
Write sentences about different jobs
Use 'does' and 'works' correctly
Listen to descriptions of different occupations
Speak about aspirations and future work
Read job advertisements and understand key information
Write about skills needed for different jobs
Use present continuous tense (is working)
Describe workplace environments using adjectives
Create profiles of different professionals

themes.name: Child Protection
competences: Read and understand rights-related vocabulary
Write about personal safety and boundaries
Use appropriate language to report concerns
Listen to protection messages attentively
Speak about personal safety in age-appropriate ways
Read and understand protection policies
Write about trusted adults and help sources
Use 'can', 'should', 'must' for safety guidance
Understand good and bad touch concepts
Create safety communication materials

themes.name: Animals and Plants
competences: Read and spell names of animals and plants
Write sentences about animal and plant characteristics
Use singular and plural forms correctly
Listen to nature stories and descriptions
Describe animals and plants using adjectives
Read and understand science-related vocabulary
Write about habitats and environments
Use simple present tense for animal behaviors
Create fact files about animals and plants
Write poetry about nature

themes.name: Time and Seasons
competences: Read and write months and days correctly
Write sentences about seasonal changes
Use time-related prepositions (in, on, at, during)
Listen to descriptions of seasonal activities
Speak about favorite seasons and activities
Read and understand weather vocabulary
Write about seasonal clothing and food
Use adverbial phrases for time (last week, next month)
Create seasonal calendars with descriptions
Write poetry about the seasons

themes.name: Water and Cleanliness
competences: Read and spell water-related vocabulary
Write sentences about water and hygiene
Use imperative verbs for cleanliness (wash, rinse, dry)
Listen to information about water conservation
Speak about importance of clean water
Read and understand health and safety instructions
Write about water sources and usage
Use 'should', 'must', 'can' for health advice
Create posters promoting cleanliness
Write stories about water and sanitation

learning_outcomes: Develop fluency in reading and understanding English texts
Write coherent sentences and simple texts
Communicate effectively in English in various contexts
Expand vocabulary related to daily life and learning
Use correct grammar and punctuation conventions
Listen attentively and understand spoken English
Speak with clarity and confidence in English
Develop appreciation for English language and literature
